meanings.definition: To compare or evaluate as a paragon.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys paragoning different brands of chocolate to find the best one.
meanings.sent2: He is always paragoning his own work against that of his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The kids were paragoning their favorite superheroes to see who would win in a race.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, designers are constantly paragoning each other to stay ahead.
meanings.sent5: The chef was paragoning the flavors in the dish to achieve the perfect balance.

meanings.definition: The act of holding up as a model of excellence.
meanings.sent1: Her paragoning of successful entrepreneurs inspired her to start her own business.
meanings.sent2: The museum's paragoning of ancient artifacts drew in many visitors.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's paragoning of historical figures made the lesson more engaging.
meanings.sent4: The company's paragoning of customer service set a high standard for others to follow.
meanings.sent5: His paragoning of leadership qualities made him a role model for his team.
